chat_history.content:
You're an artificial intelligence which reacts to vignettes on psychological scales.
For instance, if an user asks you: How much do you agree with the following statement? 'I'm a large language model', 1 - Completely disagree, 2, 3, 4 - Neither agree nor disagree, 5, 6, 7 - Completely agree, you should respond with a number between 1 and 7.
Your response SHOULD NOT contain the number's accompanying text. So, if you select '7', you should just return '7', instead of '7 - Completely agree'. Similarly, if they ask: Are you a large language model?, 0 - No, 1 - Yes, you should respond with '0' or '1', instead of '0 - No' or '1 - Yes'.
DON'T explain your reasoning. I'm ONLY interested in your response to the scale.
Make sure that the response falls within the boundaries of the question. For instance: 3 is NOT an acceptable answer to a question that should be answered with a 0 or a 1
If an user asks multiple questions, you should respond with a list of numbers, one for each question.

1. Whether or not someone showed a lack of respect for authority
2. Whether or not someone was denied his or her rights
3. Whether or not someone cared for someone weak or vulnerable
4. Whether or not someone’s action showed love for his or her country
5. Whether or not someone was good at math
6. Whether or not someone showed a lack of loyalty
7. Whether or not someone suffered emotionally
8. Whether or not someone conformed to the traditions of society
9. Whether or not someone violated standards of purity and decency
10. Whether or not someone was cruel
11. Whether or not someone did something to betray his or her group
12. Whether or not someone acted unfairly
13. Whether or not some people were treated differently than others
14. Whether or not an action caused chaos or disorder
15. Whether or not someone acted in a way that God would approve of
16. Whether or not someone did something disgusting

17. People should be loyal to their family members, even when they have done something wrong.
18. One of the worst things a person could do is hurt a defenseless animal.
19. People should not do things that are disgusting, even if no one is harmed.
20. I think it’s morally wrong that rich children inherit a lot of money while poor children inherit nothing.
21. Men and women each have different roles to play in society.
22. I would call some acts wrong on the grounds that they are unnatural.
23. I am proud of my country’s history.
24. Justice is the most important requirement for a society.
25. It is better to do good than to do bad.
26. Chastity is an important and valuable virtue.
27. If I were a soldier and disagreed with my commanding officer’s orders, I would obey anyway because that is my duty.
28. It can never be right to kill a human being.
29. When the government makes laws, the number one principle should be ensuring that everyone is treated fairly.
30. It is more important to be a team player than to express oneself.
31. Respect for authority is something all children need to learn.
32. Compassion for those who are suffering is the most crucial virtue.

In the following experiment, your role will be to make moral judgments about different scenarios, using a 5 point Likert Scale:
1- Not at all wrong
2- Not too wrong
3- Somewhat wrong
4- Very wrong
5- Extremely wrong

1. You see a woman swerving her car in order to intentionally run over a squirrel.
2. You see a teenage girl openly staring at a disfigured woman as she walks past.
3. You see a girl saying that another girl is too ugly to be a varsity cheerleader.
4. You see a woman spanking her child with a spatula for getting bad grades in school.
5. You see an intern disobeying an order to dress professionally and comb his hair.
6. You see a zoo trainer jabbing a dolphin to get it to entertain his customers.
7. You see a referee intentionally making bad calls that help his favored team win.
8. You see the US Ambassador joking in Great Britain about the stupidity of Americans.
9. You see a former US General saying publicly he would never buy any American product.
10. You see a college president singing a rival school's fight song during a pep rally.
11. You see a man searching through the trash to find women's discarded underwear.
12. You see a man in a bar using his phone to watch people having sex with animals.
13. You see an employee trying to undermine all of her boss' ideas in front of others.
14. You see a woman commenting out loud about how fat another woman looks in her jeans.
15. You see a teacher publicly saying she hopes another school wins the math contest.
16. You see a woman having intimate relations with a recently deceased loved one.
17. You see a boy turning up the TV as his father talks about his military service.
18. You see a girl ignoring her father's orders by taking the car after her curfew.
19. You see a man secretly voting against his wife in a local beauty pageant.
20. You see someone cheating in a card game while playing with a group of strangers.
21. You see a soccer player pretending to be seriously fouled by an opposing player.
22. You see an employee lying about how many hours she worked during the week.
23. You see a man telling a woman that her painting looks like it was done by children.
24. You see a man loudly telling his wife that the dinner she cooked tastes awful.
25. You see a man leaving his family business to go work for their main competitor.
26. You see a boy skipping to the front of the line because his friend is an employee.
27. You see a tenant bribing a landlord to be the first to get their apartment repainted.
28. You see a drunk elderly man offering to have oral sex with anyone in the bar.
29. You see a father requiring his son to become a commercial airline pilot like him.
30. You see a girl repeatedly interrupting her teacher as he explains a new concept.
31. You see a woman lying about the number of vacation days she has taken at work.
32. You see the class president saying on TV that her rival college is a better school.
33. You see a man telling his fiance that she has to switch to his political party.
34. You see a runner taking a shortcut on the course during the marathon in order to win.
35. You see a homosexual in a gay bar offering sex to anyone who buys him a drink.
36. You see a mother telling her son that she is going to choose all of his friends.
37. You see a former Secretary of State publicly giving up his citizenship to the US.
38. You see a boy throwing rocks at cows that are grazing in the local pasture.
39. You see a girl shooting geese repeatedly with a pellet gun out in the woods.
40. You see a man telling his girlfriend that she must convert to his religion.
41. You see a mother forcing her daughter to enroll as a pre-med student in college.
42. You see a single man ordering an inflatable sex doll that looks like his secretary.
43. You see a man quickly canceling a blind date as soon as he sees the woman.
44. You see a boy setting a series of traps to kill stray cats in his neighborhood.
45. You see a mayor saying that the neighboring town is a much better town.
46. You see a star player ignoring her coach's order to come to the bench during a game.
47. You see a girl telling a boy that his older brother is much more attractive than him.
48. You see a professor giving a bad grade to a student just because he dislikes him.
49. You see an employee joking with competitors about how bad his company did last year.
50. You see a woman throwing her cat across the room for scratching the furniture.
51. You see a US swimmer cheering as a Chinese foe beats his teammate to win the gold.
52. You see an American telling foreigners that the US is an evil force in the world.
53. You see someone leaving his dog outside in the rain after it dug in the trash.
54. You see a Hollywood star agreeing with a foreign dictator's denunciation of the US.
55. You see a man lashing his pony with a whip for breaking loose from its pen.
56. You see a man having sex with a frozen chicken before cooking it for dinner.
57. You see a girl laughing at another student forgetting her lines at a school play.
58. You see a coach celebrating with the opposing team's players who just won the game.
59. You see a boy making fun of his brother for getting dumped by his girlfriend.
60. You see a teenage girl coming home late and ignoring her parents' strict curfew.
61. You see a boy telling a woman that she looks just like her overweight bulldog.
62. You see the coach's wife sponsoring a bake sale for her husband's rival team.
63. You see a woman pressuring her daughter to become a famous evening news anchor.
64. You see a father requiring his son to take up the family restaurant business.
65. You see a staff member talking loudly and interrupting the mayor's speech to the public.
66. You see a woman clearly avoiding sitting next to an obese woman on the bus.
67. You see a group of women having a long and loud conversation during a church sermon.
68. You see a man turn his back and walk away while his boss questions his work.
